text: Glenn Dawson Wheatley (23 January 1948 â€“ 1 February 2022) was an Australian musician, talent manager and music promoter. Wheatley began his career as a musician in the mid-1960s. He played for the pop rock band the Masters Apprentices as bass guitarist. He was later a manager for Little River Band and John Farnham. Wheatley died on 1 February 2022 in Melbourne at the age of 74 from problems caused by COVID-19. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1948 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Australian businesspeople Category:Musicians from Queensland Category:Musicians from Melbourne Category:Australian rock musicians Category:Australian pop musicians Category:Australian guitarists Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic
title: Glenn Wheatley
